DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Unit Unique Identifier Same Institution Unique Identifier Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the umbilical cord blood unit unique identifier is the same as the institution unique identifier.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Unit Unique Identifier Same Institution Unique Identifier

It serves as a means of identification and reference (often instead of a name) for an entity, person, thing, function, procedure, activity, variable, or body of data._Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree._An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.::(ICCBBA )- International Council for Commonality in Blood Banking Automation, Inc. _A set of characters used as a code that is unique in the context or the system for which it is created. It serves as a means of identification and reference (often instead of a name) for an entity, person, thing, function, procedure, activity, variable, or body of data.::(ISBT 128)- a global standard for the identification, labeling and information processing of human blood, tissue and organ products across international borders and disparate health care systems. [manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Unit Unique Identifier
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.:A set of characters used as a code that is unique in the context or the system for which it is created. It serves as a means of identification and reference (often instead of a name) for an entity, person, thing, function, procedure, activity, variable, or a body of data.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the CBU ID number also the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the CBU ID number also the ICCBBA ISBT 128 number?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2764233
ReferenceDocuments.description: "[IF EXISTS THEN ""true"" ELSE ""false""]  Subject [Donor] > BiologicEntity >   BiologicEntityIdentifier.identifier [1] = BiologicEntityIdentifier.identifier [2] WHERE  BiologicEntityIdentifier.identifier [2] > BiologicEntity > Subject [Donor] AND BiologicEntityIdentifier.typeCode [1] = ""NMDP"" AND BiologicEntityIdentifier.typeCode [2] = ""ICCBBA ISBT 128"""
